title: School deficit projections and licensed deficit arrangements 2024/2025

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide me with the following information:
1) The number of local authority maintained schools in the Council area which are projecting a deficit budget for the 2024/2025 school year.
2) Of those schools identified in question 1, the number for which the local authority has decided not to agree a licensed deficit arrangement.
Yours faithfully,
Helen Cross

Dear Helen Cross,
Thank you for your request for information relating to school deficit
projections and licensed deficit arrangements 2024/2025 which we received
on 18/07/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 16/08/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Helen Cross,
Thank you for your request for information relating to school deficit
projections and licensed deficit arrangements 2024/2025 which we received
on 18/07/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1. The number of local authority-maintained schools in the Council area
which are projecting a deficit budget for the 2024/2025 school year.
• At the start of the financial year, there were sixteen schools
forecasting a deficit balance at the end of 2024/25. Please note this
is financial year, we do not hold the information based on school
year.
2. Of those schools identified in question 1, the number for which the
local authority has decided not to agree a licensed deficit
arrangement.
• At present, there are no schools. We are still awaiting and reviewing
some applications.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...

Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
